column4: Also, my wireless card worked fine for 7.10 but when I installed 8.04, it did not
well, there's a lot of wireless cards out there, perhaps you could narrow it down
again, what wireless adapter do you have?
post #2...  http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=826233&highlight=aironet
That will require a reboot?
and what was the other problem?
well, what is the CD of?
well i don't see why you'd need either of those from a CD, just download the updates since your wireless is working
i see.
well plug the thumb drive in, give it a second, then run lsusb in a terminal and see if you see an entry for it.
does your user have access to external drives?
system/admin/users and groups... click unlock, enter password, highlight your user, click password, and look at user priv.
second part should be click *properties*... not click passwword, then click user priv. tab
is the thumb drive plugged in right now?
got o Places/Computer.. then click on Filesystem, and look in the /media folder... (witht he thumb drive plugged in)
dunno to be truthful... what filesystem is the thumb drive formatted as?.. NTFS?
i really don't know.. doesn't make sense... do you have something else USB you could try?
the fact lsusb showed no output when the drive was plugged in,s ays its not being seen at all,
wel, your desktop doesn't have Linux on it if i understand correctly
i didn't suggest the problem was the flash drive
i bet your usb ports aren't working.. do you have somethig real simple, like maybe a USB mouse, you could plug into the port, see if it works?
